Html: I read about application modes and contextual tabs but all these are predefined templates and compiled into the same ribbon. What I wonder is if I can have a dynamically loaded dll that has it's own contextual tab definition and combining it with the main ribbon? I haven't checked this but I assume that Office can do this using add-ins.

As far as I know you cannot do this…. Office doesn’t use the Windows Ribbon Framework, but rather its own one.

From: naleksiev [email removed]
Sent: Wednesday, February 29, 2012 5:42 AM
To: Michael Scidone
Subject: Ribbon with Plugins [windowsribbon:346631]

From: naleksiev

I read about application modes and contextual tabs but all these are predefined templates and compiled into the same ribbon. What I wonder is if I can have a dynamically loaded dll that has it's own contextual tab definition and combining it with the main ribbon? I haven't checked this but I assume that Office can do this using add-ins.
